meanings.definition: A person or thing that whets.
meanings.sent1: The whetter sharpened the knife before the big feast.
meanings.sent2: I always keep a whetter in my kitchen to keep my knives sharp.
meanings.sent3: The chef's secret weapon was a magical whetter that made all the food taste better.
meanings.sent4: Her enthusiasm was like a whetter, sparking excitement in everyone around her.
meanings.sent5: The old man was known as the whetter of appetites, always preparing delicious meals.

meanings.definition: To sharpen by grinding or friction.
meanings.sent1: She carefully whettered the blade of the axe before chopping wood.
meanings.sent2: It is important to whetter your tools regularly to keep them in good condition.
meanings.sent3: The blacksmith's apprentice accidentally whettered his finger instead of the blade.
meanings.sent4: The sound of the whetter against the metal was like music to his ears.
meanings.sent5: The old man's wisdom seemed to whetter the minds of all who listened to him.

meanings.sent1: The speaker's words whettered the curiosity of the audience.
meanings.sent2: Music has the power to whetter our emotions and transport us to another world.
meanings.sent3: The magician used his wand to whetter the crowd's anticipation for his next trick.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like a whetter, spreading joy wherever it went.
meanings.sent5: The smell of fresh bread baking in the oven always whettered my appetite.
